en: Please have a try.
zh: 试试看吧。

en: Please come and see me again.
zh: 有空再来看我。

en: Please use your headsets.
zh: 请戴上耳机。

en: Pass me the butter, will you please.
zh: 帮我拿一下黄油，好吗？

en: By all means.
zh: 当然可以。

en: Open the door, please.
zh: 开下门。

en: Close the door, please.
zh: 关下门。

en: Please turn on the television.
zh: 把电视打开。

en: Please turn it on.
zh: 把它打开。

en: Please see that the job is finished.
zh: 请确保把活儿干完。

en: Please be careful not to let the dog loose.
zh: 注意别让狗跑了。

en: Please put me through to Mr Smith.
zh: 请帮我转接史密斯先生。

en: Please be seated, ladies and gentlemen.
zh: 各位请坐。

en: Please tell me your address.
zh: 请告诉我你的地址。

en: Please help yourself.
zh: 别客气，自便。

en: Help yourself, please.
zh: 别客气，自己来。

en: Be my guest.
zh: 请便。

en: Please put this into English.
zh: 请把这个翻译成英语。

en: Please stay as long as you wish.
zh: 想住多久就住多久。

en: Take this seat, please.
zh: 请坐这儿吧。

en: Please translate this sentence into Japanese.
zh: 请把这句话翻译成日语。

en: Please have a seat here.
zh: 请坐这儿。

en: Go ahead.
zh: 您请。

en: Please write down your name, address, and phone number here.
zh: 请在这儿写下你的姓名、地址和电话。

en: Go ahead. Your party is on the line.
zh: 请讲，电话接通了。

en: Please drop in on us.
zh: 有空来坐坐。

en: Please take care of yourself.
zh: 照顾好自己。

en: Do me the favor of coming.
zh: 请务必赏光。

en: Please don't bother.
zh: 不用麻烦了。

en: Please make yourself comfortable.
zh: 别拘束。

en: Make yourself comfortable.
zh: 随意点。

en: Please help yourself to the cakes.
zh: 请随便吃点蛋糕。

en: Please don't get up.
zh: 您别起来。

en: Please make yourself at home, and help yourself to some coffee.
zh: 别客气，喝点咖啡。

en: Please have a second helping.
zh: 再多吃点儿吧。

en: Sit down, please.
zh: 请坐。

en: Please have a seat.
zh: 请坐。

en: Please tell me about your trip.
zh: 跟我说说你的旅行吧。

en: Please do as it seems best to you.
zh: 你觉得怎么好就怎么做吧。

en: Please go up to the third floor.
zh: 请上三楼。

en: I appreciate your request to reproduce 70 copies of my report.
zh: 感谢你提出复印70份我的报告。

en: Please, tell me.
zh: 告诉我吧。

en: Please get a lot of pencils.
zh: 多拿点铅笔。

en: Have another glass of beer, please.
zh: 再来杯啤酒吧。

en: Please remain seated.
zh: 请留在座位上。

en: Yes, please do.
zh: 好的，请便。

en: Tell me about yourself, please, Sir Anthony.
zh: 安东尼爵士，请谈谈你自己。

en: Please write down your name here.
zh: 请在这儿写下你的名字。

en: Will you step this way, please?
zh: 请这边走。

en: Please help yourself to the cookies.
zh: 请随便吃点饼干。

en: Go ahead!
zh: 开始吧。

en: I wish you every happiness.
zh: 祝你永远幸福。

en: Help yourself to the cake, please.
zh: 别客气，想吃蛋糕自己拿哈。

en: Please take a seat.
zh: 请坐。

en: The essence of Japanese culture could never be appreciated by them.
zh: 日本文化的精髓，他们根本体会不到。

en: I daresay you are going to go no matter what.
zh: 我敢说，不管怎么样你肯定都要去的。

en: At any rate, if you learn English, study it thoroughly.
zh: 不管怎么说，既然学英语，就得学扎实。

en: If you learn English at all, learn it thoroughly.
zh: 既然要学英语，就得把它学透。

en: If you do it at all, try to do it well.
zh: 既然要做，就尽量做好。

en: As he's just up on his high horse again.
zh: 他又在那儿摆臭架子了。

en: You're only foolin' round.
zh: 你就在那儿瞎胡闹呢。

en: How can I get to heaven?
zh: 我怎么才能上天堂？

en: How can we abolish war?
zh: 我们要怎么才能消灭战争？

en: How can I make a long-distance call?
zh: 长途电话要怎么打？

en: How can I reach you?
zh: 我怎么联系你？

en: I am at a loss what to do.
zh: 我不知道该怎么办了。

en: Not knowing what to do, I asked the teacher for advice.
zh: 我不知道该怎么办，就请教了老师。

en: How can I succeed in getting a date with Nancy?
zh: 我怎么才能约到南希呢？

en: What are you going to do about it?
zh: 你打算怎么办？

en: In making a decision, I rely not on logic but on instinct.
zh: 我做决定不靠逻辑，靠直觉。

en: It can't be helped.
zh: 没办法。

en: I can't start up my computer. What am I supposed to do?
zh: 电脑开不了机，我该怎么办？

en: Not knowing what to do, I asked him for help.
zh: 我不知道该怎么办，就找他帮忙了。

en: How is it she does not come?
zh: 她怎么没来？

en: How come she hung up on you?
zh: 她怎么挂你电话啊？

en: What made her so angry?
zh: 什么事让她生这么生气？

en: How did she get mixed up with such unpleasant people?
zh: 她是怎么跟那种讨厌的人混在一起的？

en: How did you get acquainted with her?
zh: 你是怎么认识她的？

en: I don't understand why she is opposed to my opinion.
zh: 我不明白她为什么反对我的意见。

en: Will you tell me why you like her?
zh: 你能告诉我你为什么喜欢她吗？

en: I can't figure out why she didn't come.
zh: 我想不通她为什么没来。

en: How did you get to know him?
zh: 你是怎么认识他的？

en: Why did they turn down your proposal?
zh: 他们为什么拒绝了你的提议？

en: Why did they come to believe in such a religion?
zh: 他们怎么会信那种教？

en: How can we dispel their doubts and fears?
zh: 我们要怎么消除他们的疑虑和恐惧？

en: What prevented him from coming?
zh: 什么事耽误了他没来？

en: What makes him hated?
zh: 他怎么这么招人恨？

en: Why should he think that he knows better than I do?
zh: 凭什么他觉得他比我懂得多？

en: Why is he looking at me as though he knows me?
zh: 他干嘛盯着我看，搞得好像认识我一样？

en: I wonder what has made him change his mind.
zh: 我纳闷是什么让他改变了主意。

en: How come he hates Molly?
zh: 他怎么会讨厌莫莉呢？

en: What had kept him from coming to the party?
zh: 什么事让他没能来参加聚会？

en: Why might he have done that, I wonder?
zh: 我真纳闷他为什么要那样做。

en: Why is he angry about something like that?
zh: 那种事有什么好生气的？

en: What made him so angry then, I wonder?
zh: 我纳闷他当时怎么生那么大气？

en: Why are you so hard on him?
zh: 你干嘛对他那么凶？

en: I can't figure out why he didn't tell the truth.
zh: 我想不通他为什么不说实话。

en: You are mistaken as to what makes him so nervous.
zh: 关于他为什么这么紧张，你搞错了。

en: I cannot figure out why he has done that.
zh: 我搞不懂他为什么要那样做。

en: Why are you drying your hair?
zh: 你干嘛在弄干头发？

en: Why don't you come in?
zh: 怎么不进来？

en: Why did you fail in the entrance examination?
zh: 入学考试你怎么没考过？

en: And why do you think that is?
zh: 那你觉得是为什么呢？

en: Why has Japan let pollution get so bad?
zh: 日本怎么会让污染变得这么严重？

en: I wondered why people were staring at me.
zh: 我还在想大家干嘛都盯着我看。

en: Why can Taro speak English so well?
zh: 太郎英语怎么说得那么好？

en: I wonder why nobody told me.
zh: 真奇怪，怎么没人告诉我。

en: Why did you run away?
zh: 你跑什么呀？

en: Why don't you try to behave like a gentleman?
zh: 你就不能表现得绅士一点吗？

en: Why has the birthrate declined so sharply?
zh: 出生率怎么降得这么厉害？

en: Why not apologize and ask for his pardon?
zh: 干嘛不干脆去道个歉，求他原谅呢？

en: Why did you leave out the first question in the exam?
zh: 考试第一道题你怎么没做啊？

en: How come you aren't taking me?
zh: 你怎么不带我去啊？

en: Why are you holding my hands?
zh: 你干嘛拉着我的手？

en: What made you think that my favorite color was green?
zh: 你怎么会觉得我最喜欢绿色？

en: Why have you bought the same camera as I have?
zh: 你怎么买了个跟我一模一样的相机？

en: Why ask me? Wouldn't it be better to do it yourself?
zh: 问我干嘛？你自己做不是更好吗？

en: Why all of a sudden did he ask me such a serious question?
zh: 他怎么突然问我这么严肃的问题？

en: How can I jump so high?
zh: 我怎么能跳这么高？

en: How should I know where he is?
zh: 我哪知道他在哪儿啊？

en: What makes you think that I'm against that?
zh: 你怎么会觉得我反对呢？

en: I don't see why I should not do that.
zh: 我觉得没理由不那么做啊。

en: How come you didn't call me last night?
zh: 你昨晚怎么没给我打电话？

en: I wonder why it's so crowded here today.
zh: 今天这儿怎么这么挤啊？

en: Why don't you ever say it?
zh: 你怎么从来都不说呢？

en: How did a total stranger know his name?
zh: 一个素不相识的人怎么会知道他的名字？

en: How can you believe that she made away with the papers?
zh: 你怎么能相信是她拿走了文件呢？

en: Why didn't you get one before we left?
zh: 咱们走之前你怎么没买一个？

en: How come you say nothing?
zh: 你怎么不说话呀？

en: How did you come to know it?
zh: 你是怎么知道的？

en: What are you doing that for?
zh: 你干嘛要那样做？

en: How can you tolerate such a deed?
zh: 你怎么能容忍这种行为？

en: How comes it that you were there?
zh: 你怎么会在那儿呢？

en: What made you come here so early?
zh: 你怎么来得这么早？

en: Let's check why your answers differ from mine.
zh: 咱们来看看为什么你的答案跟我的不一样。

en: I can't understand how your father managed to see through that man.
zh: 我真搞不懂你爸是怎么看穿那个人的。

en: How come you don't know this?
zh: 你怎么连这个都不知道？

en: How come you are here?
zh: 你怎么在这儿？

en: Why are you under the desk?
zh: 你钻桌子底下干嘛？

en: Why did you come home so late?
zh: 你怎么回来得这么晚？

en: Why did you part with your house?
zh: 你干嘛要把房子卖了？

en: What made up your mind to quit smoking?
zh: 你怎么下定决心要戒烟的？

en: I wonder why they left my name off the list.
zh: 我纳闷名单上怎么没有我的名字。

en: Not knowing what to do, I asked for help.
zh: 我不知道该怎么办，只好求助。

en: Not knowing what to do, I was at a loss.
zh: 我不知道该怎么办，完全不知所措。

en: Not knowing what to do, I telephoned the police.
zh: 我不知道该怎么办，就报警了。

en: How can I forget those days?
zh: 我怎么能忘得了那段日子呢？

en: I can't recall her name.
zh: 我想不起她叫什么名字了。

en: I can't for the life of me remember her phone number.
zh: 我死活想不起她的电话号码。

en: I can't for the life of me remember her address.
zh: 我死活也想不起她的地址了。

en: I couldn't bring myself to tell her the truth.
zh: 我实在没法开口跟她说实话。

en: I could not remember his name for the life of me.
zh: 我死活记不起他的名字。

en: We could not open the box anyhow.
zh: 我们怎么也打不开那个盒子。

en: For some reason or other I cannot bring myself to work.
zh: 不知怎么的，我就是没心思干活。

en: I just can't memorize students' names.
zh: 我就是记不住学生的名字。

en: I can't recall the exact words.
zh: 我想不起原话是怎么说的了。

en: I'm just a creature of habit, I guess.
zh: 我想我这人大概就是习惯成自然吧。

en: I want to get rid of it.
zh: 我想把它处理掉。

en: For the life of me, I couldn't remember his name.
zh: 我死活想不起他的名字。

en: Accidents will happen.
zh: 意外总是在所难免。

en: At all costs, I want to live in America.
zh: 无论如何，我也要住在美国。

en: I could never make him believe what I said.
zh: 我怎么也没法让他相信我说的话。

en: I just can't make up my mind.
zh: 我就是拿不定主意。

en: I can't recollect how to do it.
zh: 我想不起这该怎么做了。

en: If you are going to smoke, please go outside.
zh: 要抽烟的话，请去外面。

en: I cannot understand it for the life of me.
zh: 我死活也搞不明白。

en: I couldn't bring myself to take the job.
zh: 我没法说服自己接下那份工作。

en: I cannot for the life of me remember where it was.
zh: 我死活想不起那是哪儿了。

en: I simply cannot get rid of this bad cold of mine.
zh: 我这感冒就是好不了。

en: I do want to go to Italy.
zh: 我真的很想去意大利。

en: Why did you paint the bench red?
zh: 你干嘛把长凳漆成红色？

en: Why did you give up the idea of learning French?
zh: 你怎么放弃学法语的念头了？

en: What made Bill decide to be an engineer?
zh: 是什么让比尔决定当工程师的？

en: How did you get to play the violin?
zh: 你是怎么开始拉小提琴的？

en: Why don't you get rid of your motorcycle? You never ride it any more.
zh: 你干嘛不把摩托车处理掉？你反正也不骑了。

en: Why didn't you say anything?
zh: 你刚才怎么什么都没说？

en: Why do they call New York the Big Apple?
zh: 为什么大家管纽约叫“大苹果”？

en: What makes you think that way?
zh: 你怎么会那么想？

en: Why did you say such a stupid thing?
zh: 你干嘛说这种傻话？

en: How can you say such a silly thing?
zh: 你怎么能说出这种傻话？

en: How did you arrive at such a conclusion?
zh: 你是怎么得出这种结论的？

en: How can you bear such a humiliation?
zh: 你怎么受得了这种侮辱？

en: Why do you take such a risk?
zh: 你为什么要冒这种险？

en: How come you made such a mistake?
zh: 你怎么会犯这种错误？

en: How can you be so calm?
zh: 你怎么能这么冷静？

en: What made you say such a stupid thing as that?
zh: 是什么让你说出这种傻话的？

en: Clara asked me why I worked so hard.
zh: 克拉拉问我为什么要这么拼命工作。

en: How can you be so passive? Why don't you retaliate?
zh: 你怎么能这么消极？干嘛不反击？

en: Why are you so late?
zh: 你怎么迟到这么久？

en: Why are you so angry?
zh: 你怎么发这么大火？

en: What do you want such an old car for?
zh: 你要这么旧的车干嘛？

en: Why does that require an apology?
zh: 这事儿干嘛要道歉？

en: Tell me what makes you so depressed.
zh: 告诉我你为什么这么郁闷。

en: How did such a thing come about?
zh: 这种事是怎么发生的？

en: How did you come to believe that?
zh: 你是怎么相信那个的？

en: How did you come to hear of it?
zh: 你是怎么听说这件事的？

en: Why did the lawyer lose in the argument?
zh: 律师在辩论中怎么输了？

en: How did the accident come about?
zh: 事故是怎么发生的？

en: What makes you think so?
zh: 你为什么这么想？

en: What put such an idea into your head?
zh: 你怎么会有这种念头？

en: What do you learn Spanish for?
zh: 你学西班牙语是为了什么？

en: How can you afford another suit?
zh: 你怎么又买得起一套西服了？

en: I can't understand why James always finds fault with his wife.
zh: 我不明白詹姆斯为什么老是找他老婆的茬。

en: What led you to this conclusion?
zh: 你是怎么得出这个结论的？

en: How did this misunderstanding ever arise?
zh: 这个误会是怎么产生的？

en: How come you call on us so late at night?
zh: 你怎么半夜三更来找我们？

en: Why did you call me at this unearthly hour?
zh: 你怎么在大半夜给我打电话？

en: How can I quit this job?
zh: 我该怎么辞掉这份工作？

en: How is it that you can speak this language?
zh: 你是怎么会说这种语言的？

en: How did this dangerous state come about?
zh: 这种危险的情况是怎么造成的？

en: What did you come here for?
zh: 你来这儿干什么？

en: I wonder why karaoke is so popular.
zh: 我纳闷卡拉OK怎么会这么火。

en: I had no idea what to do.
zh: 我当时完全不知道该怎么办。

en: Why will you not listen to reason?
zh: 你怎么就不听劝呢？

en: Not knowing what to do, he asked me for help.
zh: 他不知道该怎么办，只好找我帮忙。

en: Not knowing what to do, we telephoned the police.
zh: 我们不知道该怎么办，就报警了。

en: Why didn't you follow my advice?
zh: 你怎么不听我的建议呢？

en: What made you do a silly thing like that?
zh: 你怎么会做出这种傻事？

en: Why should I apologize to you?
zh: 我凭什么向你道歉？

en: What made you think so?
zh: 你怎么会这么想？

en: Why can't you take things just as they are?
zh: 你为什么就不能接受现实呢？

en: Why do they say you have to learn English to survive?
zh: 为什么大家都说要学好英语才能生存？

en: Why didn't you tell us about this earlier? We'd have been able to do something about it.
zh: 你怎么不早点告诉我们？这样我们还能帮上忙。

en: Why is it so hot?
zh: 天气怎么这么热？

en: How come you didn't come to the party?
zh: 聚会你怎么没来？

en: What happened? The car's slowing down.
zh: 发生什么事了？车慢下来了。

en: What's up, Mike?
zh: 迈克，怎么了？

en: What has estranged him from his sister?
zh: 是什么让他和他姐姐的关系疏远了？

en: Tell me how to beat sleeplessness.
zh: 跟我说说怎么治失眠。

en: Please tell me how I can get in touch with him.
zh: 请告诉我怎么能联系到他。

en: I don't know how to satisfy his need for constant attention.
zh: 我不知道该怎么满足他那种时刻想引人注意的欲望。

en: How can I become rich?
zh: 我怎么才能发财？

en: How can we buy British goods?
zh: 我们怎么能买到英国货？

en: As I was at a loss what to do, I asked my teacher for advice.
zh: 我当时不知道该怎么办，就去请教老师了。

en: I was almost at my wits' end how to act.
zh: 我当时简直是束手无策了。

en: How can I start the engine?
zh: 发动机怎么启动？

en: Not knowing what to do, she remained silent.
zh: 她不知道该怎么办，就一直沉默着。

en: How can I get to the zoo from here?
zh: 从这儿去动物园怎么走？

en: He asked me what was the matter with me.
zh: 他问我怎么了。

en: What's the matter with you? You look pale.
zh: 你怎么了？脸色看着很难看。

en: What's the trouble? Can I be of any help?
zh: 出什么事了？需要我帮忙吗？

en: What's the matter, dad? Why are you grimacing like that?
zh: 爸，怎么了？怎么在那儿龇牙咧嘴的？

en: Have you lost your marbles, wearing those bellbottoms?
zh: 你疯了吗，穿这种喇叭裤？

en: Please remain standing.
zh: 请继续站着。

en: Please wake me up at six tomorrow morning.
zh: 明天早上六点记得叫我起床。

en: Turn on the light, please.
zh: 请把灯打开。

en: Please let me make it up to you.
zh: 请让我补偿你。

en: Please remember to mail the letter.
zh: 记得把这封信寄了。

en: Please forgive me.
zh: 请原谅我。

en: Please come in an ordinary dress.
zh: 穿便装来就行。

en: Please correct my pronunciation.
zh: 帮我纠正一下发音。

en: I entreat you to go and see him.
zh: 算我求你了，去看看他吧。

en: Let me know the way.

en: It's no use on earth.
zh: 这真是一点用都没有。

en: Which do you like better, Denver or Montreal?
zh: 丹佛和蒙特利尔，你更喜欢哪个？

en: The festive mood was slightly spoiled by terrorist bombs.
zh: 恐怖袭击的炸弹让节日气氛大打折扣。

en: The grenade blew up before the terrorist could throw it, and his arm was blown off!
zh: 手榴弹还没等那恐怖分子扔出去就炸了，把他胳膊都炸飞了！

en: Where can I get a telephone card?
zh: 在哪儿能买到电话卡？

en: Some TV programs are interesting, and others are not.
zh: 有些电视节目挺有意思，有些就挺无聊的。

en: TV programs have a bad influence on children.
zh: 电视节目对孩子有坏影响。

en: The TV telephone will come into popular use soon.
zh: 视频电话很快就会普及了。

en: He was arrested by police after a TV chase in Osaka.
zh: 在大阪的一场电视直播追捕后，他被警察抓住了。

en: Can I turn off the TV?
zh: 我能把电视关了吗？

en: There are movements to try to ban TV advertising.
zh: 现在有人在倡导禁止电视广告。

en: Television viewers see only what the camera shows.
zh: 电视观众只能看到镜头展示的东西。

en: May I turn on the TV?
zh: 我能开下电视吗？

en: Please turn on the TV.
zh: 请把电视打开。

en: May I turn on the television?
zh: 我可以开电视吗？

en: We'll visit a factory which produces television sets.
zh: 我们要去参观一家生产电视机的工厂。

en: Oh, don't watch television.
zh: 哎呀，别看电视了。

en: Please turn off the TV.
zh: 请把电视关了。

en: Turn off the TV.
zh: 把电视关掉。

en: Please turn off the television.
zh: 请把电视关掉。

en: I must get the television fixed.
zh: 我得找人修一下电视。

en: The television set needs to be fixed.
zh: 这电视机得修了。

en: It cost me ten thousand yen to have my television set repaired.
zh: 修电视花了我一万日元。

en: Please move the TV set to the left.
zh: 请把电视机往左挪一下。

en: You're to do your homework before you watch TV.
zh: 你得先做作业再看电视。

en: Do your homework before you watch TV.
zh: 先做作业，然后再看电视。

en: It's time you stopped watching television.
zh: 你该别看电视了。

en: Let's not watch TV.
zh: 咱们别看电视了吧。

en: It's fun to watch TV.
zh: 看电视挺好玩的。

en: Mary likes watching TV.
zh: 玛丽喜欢看电视。

en: I mean, when I watch T. V. I'd sit in it.
zh: 我是说，我看电视的时候会坐在这里面。

en: Watching TV is a passive activity.
zh: 看电视是一项被动的活动。

en: Watching TV is fun.
zh: 看电视很有趣。

en: Watching television changes the role of the fans by making their participation more passive and distant.
zh: 看电视改变了粉丝的角色，让他们变得更被动、更有距离感。

en: I watch television.
zh: 我看电视。

en: Some people read the newspaper while watching television.
zh: 有些人一边看电视一边看报纸。

en: Let's play cards instead of watching television.
zh: 咱们别看电视了，玩牌吧。

en: Don't watch TV.
zh: 别看电视。

en: Play outside instead of watching TV.
zh: 别看电视了，去外面玩吧。

en: Don't spend so much time watching TV.
zh: 别花那么多时间看电视。

en: I'm just watching TV.
zh: 我正在看电视呢。

en: The trouble is you cannot work while watching TV.
zh: 问题是你看电视的时候没法工作。

en: I was watching TV when the telephone rang.
zh: 电话响的时候我正在看电视。

en: I fall asleep easily while watching television.
zh: 我看电视特别容易睡着。

en: Watching TV, I fell asleep.
zh: 我看着电视就睡着了。

en: I'll do my homework after I watch television.
zh: 我看完了电视再写作业。

en: When you watch television or listen to the radio, the music which you hear is often African in origin.
zh: 你看电视或者听收音机时，听到的音乐很多都源自非洲。

en: Will you turn on the TV?
zh: 你能把电视打开吗？

en: Will you turn on the television?
zh: 帮我开下电视好吗？

en: Do you mind turning on the TV?
zh: 你介意开下电视吗？

en: Would you mind if I turned the TV on?
zh: 我开下电视你不介意吧？

en: Don't keep the TV on!
zh: 别总开着电视！

en: It was careless of him to go to bed with the TV on.
zh: 他太粗心了，开着电视就去睡觉了。

en: You must make room for the television.
zh: 你得给电视腾个地方。

en: Students don't read many books because of TV and comics.
zh: 现在的学生因为看电视和漫画都不怎么读书了。

en: Let's watch TV.
zh: 咱们看电视吧。

en: Television shows violence, which influences, above all, younger people.
zh: 电视上的暴力内容主要会影响年轻人。

en: Television has a great appeal for him.
zh: 电视对他特别有吸引力。

en: TV plays an important part in everyday life.
zh: 电视在日常生活中起着很重要的作用。

en: Television can dull our creative power.
zh: 电视会削弱我们的创造力。

en: TV is harmful in that it keeps your mind in a passive state.
zh: 电视不好，因为它会让你的思维处于被动状态。

en: Television is a very important medium through which to provide information.
zh: 电视是提供信息的一个非常重要的媒介。

en: Television is a very important medium for giving information.
zh: 电视是传递信息的重要途径。

en: You should watch television at a distance.
zh: 你看电视应该离远点。

en: Television could be an important source of culture, and its educational broadcasts are valued in many schools.
zh: 电视可以是文化的源泉，很多学校都很重视它的教育节目。

en: Television enlightens the viewers as well as entertains them.
zh: 电视既能娱乐观众，也能给人启发。

en: TV has robbed us of our enjoyment of conversation at dinner at home.
zh: 电视让我们在家吃晚饭时都没法好好聊天了。

en: Do you think television does children harm?
zh: 你觉得电视对小孩有害吗？

en: Television is ruining family life.
zh: 电视正在破坏家庭生活。

en: Television enables you to be entertained by people you wouldn't have in your home.
zh: 电视能让你欣赏到那些你平时根本接触不到的人的表演。

en: Enough TV, already!
zh: 电视看够了，别看了！

en: Television has the advantage of providing sports fans with greater convenience.
zh: 电视的好处就是能让体育迷看比赛更方便。

en: The fact that television frequently limits communication within families is already well known.
zh: 电视经常减少家人间的交流，这是大家都知道的事实。

en: TV is not watched here.
zh: 这儿不看电视。

en: When did TV appear?
zh: 电视是什么时候出现的？

en: A television set used to be a luxury.
zh: 以前电视机可是件奢侈品。

en: Some people say that cartoons on television are educational in themselves.
zh: 有人说电视上的动画片本身就有教育意义。

en: The spread of television has considerably deprived us of our time for reading.
zh: 电视的普及大大剥夺了我们的阅读时间。

en: Which of the TV programs do you like best?
zh: 你最喜欢哪个电视节目？

en: The invention of TV caused a drastic change in our daily life.
zh: 电视的发明彻底改变了我们的日常生活。

en: We take it for granted that television exists.
zh: 我们觉得有电视是理所当然的事。

en: Please adjust the television picture.
zh: 请调一下电视画面。

en: Turn up the TV.
zh: 把电视声音开大点。

en: The TV picture was blurred.
zh: 电视画面很模糊。

en: Do you mind if I turn down the TV?
zh: 我把电视调小声点，你介意吗？

en: Turn down the TV.
zh: 把电视关小声点。

en: Turn down the TV a little. I'm trying to go to sleep.
zh: 把电视关小声点，我要睡觉了。

en: Would you please turn down the TV a little?
zh: 能请你把电视声音调小一点吗？

en: Turn down the television.
zh: 把电视声音关小点。

en: Could you please turn your television down?
zh: 能麻烦你把电视声音关小点吗？

en: Where's the remote control for the TV?
zh: 电视遥控器在哪儿？

en: There is a TV remote control under the couch.
zh: 沙发底下有个电视遥控器。

en: The TV news program help us keep up with the world.
zh: 电视新闻能帮我们了解世界动态。

en: According to TV news, there was a plane crash in India.
zh: 电视新闻说印度发生了一起空难。

en: The TV newscast informs us of daily news.
zh: 电视新闻会播报每天的消息。

en: Some people insist that television does more harm than good.
zh: 有些人坚持认为电视弊大于利。

en: Thanks to television, boys and girls are apt to neglect reading books.
zh: 因为电视，现在的孩子们都不爱看书了。

en: Television enables us to know what is happening today.
zh: 电视能让我们了解今天发生了什么。

en: Television helps us widen our knowledge.
zh: 电视能帮我们增长见识。

en: Television enables us to learn about foreign manners and customs.
zh: 电视能让我们了解国外的风土人情。

en: Thanks to television, we can enjoy watching baseball games in our rooms.
zh: 多亏了电视，我们在房间里就能看棒球赛。

en: According to the TV, it will rain tomorrow.
zh: 电视上说明天要下雨。

en: What is shown on television is, as it were, a reflection of what society is like.
zh: 电视上的内容可以说是社会的缩影。

en: According to the TV, it will be fine today.
zh: 电视上说今天天气挺好。

en: I'm tired of TV.
zh: 我看腻了电视。

en: Television has robbed cinema of its former popularity.
zh: 电视抢走了电影院往日的风头。

en: It is true that television also has some disadvantages.
zh: 确实，电视也有一些缺点。

en: We can do without a television, can't we?
zh: 没电视我们也照样能过，对吧？

en: Speaking of television, what is your favorite show nowadays?
zh: 说起电视，你最近爱看什么节目？

en: I like nothing so much as to watch baseball games on television.
zh: 我最喜欢在电视上看棒球赛了。

en: It is a pleasure to watch a baseball game on TV.
zh: 在电视上看棒球赛真是一种享受。

en: Do you want to watch the baseball game on TV?
zh: 你想在电视上看棒球赛吗？

en: Many companies advertise their products on TV.
zh: 很多公司在电视上做广告。

en: The company is promoting a new car on TV.
zh: 那家公司正在电视上宣传一款新车。

en: I watched an old movie on TV.
zh: 我在电视上看了一部老电影。

en: I have seen him on TV but not in the flesh.
zh: 我在电视上见过他，但没见过真人。

en: Watching the football game on television was fun.
zh: 在电视上看足球比赛挺好玩的。

en: Cue cards are used primarily on television to help the actors remember their lines.
zh: 提词卡主要是在电视节目里帮演员记台词的。

en: You can't say four-letter words on TV.
zh: 电视上不能说脏话。

en: What about watching the night game on TV?
zh: 在电视上看晚上的比赛怎么样？

en: Can I turn on the TV?
zh: 我能开一下电视吗？

en: I enjoy watching soccer on TV.
zh: 我喜欢在电视上看足球。

en: Although it is not a bad thing in itself, in a lot of cases, many people are watching too much television.
zh: 虽然电视本身不是坏事，但很多人的确看得太多了。

en: I want a television set, but I can't afford to buy one.
zh: 我想要台电视机，但我买不起。

en: The spread of television enables us to enjoy the scenery of foreign countries.
zh: 电视的普及让我们能欣赏国外的风光。

en: The TV won't turn on.
zh: 电视开不了了。

en: I don't think TV will ever take the place of books.
zh: 我觉得电视永远没法取代书本。

en: The influence of TV on society is great.
zh: 电视对社会的影响很大。

en: The television doesn't work.
zh: 电视坏了。

en: My TV has broken down.
zh: 我的电视坏掉了。

en: Even a small sound from the TV interferes with my concentration.
zh: 哪怕是电视的一丁点声音都会让我分心。

en: TV has taken the place of radio.
zh: 电视取代了收音机。

en: Television almost has taken the place of the movie theater.
zh: 电视几乎快要取代电影院了。

en: If it were not for television, the world would feel even larger.
zh: 要不是有电视，这世界感觉会更广阔。

en: Can you imagine what life would be like without television?
zh: 你能想象没有电视的生活是什么样吗？

en: The TV was turned on.
zh: 电视开着。

en: The TV doesn't work.
zh: 电视坏了。

en: The TV was on all the time.
zh: 电视一直开着。

en: Please show me the TV Guide.
zh: 给我看下电视节目表吧。

en: The TV was so noisy that I couldn't concentrate on my reading.
zh: 电视太吵了，我根本没法专心看书。

en: The TV antenna broke away in last night's storm.
zh: 昨晚那场暴风雨把电视天线给刮断了。

en: Please answer by telex.
zh: 请用电传回复。

en: I think that Delbert is crazy.
zh: 我觉得德尔伯特疯了。

en: A delicatessen caught fire and burned down, leaving a heap of ashes.
zh: 一家熟食店起火烧没了，最后只剩下一堆灰。

en: Terry was very pleased with the news.
zh: 泰瑞听到这个消息非常高兴。

en: You'd better put your cigarette out before Terry sees it.
zh: 趁泰瑞还没看见，你最好把烟掐了。

en: I would like to see Mr Terry Tate.
zh: 我想见一下泰瑞·泰特先生。

en: Could we have a table on the terrace?
zh: 我们能在露台找个位子坐吗？

en: But I am able to cook well.
zh: 但我厨艺还挺好的。

en: But his name is slightly familiar to me.
zh: 不过他的名字我听着有点耳熟。

en: But my mind tells my fingers what to do.
zh: 但我的大脑会告诉我的手指该做什么。

en: She has a big problem, though.
zh: 不过，她确实有个大麻烦。

en: But he likes the long school holidays.
zh: 但他挺喜欢学校的长假。

en: But I enjoyed farm work.
zh: 但我以前很喜欢干农活。

en: But it's a typical savannah country, and we enjoy cooler temperatures.
zh: 但那是典型的热带草原地区，我们那儿挺凉快的。

en: But maybe guys don't like them.
zh: 但可能男生们并不喜欢。

en: The demonstrators marched in order.
zh: 游行队伍秩序井然地行进。

en: Oh, but this is great.
zh: 噢，但这真的很棒。

en: But I have to take night shifts twice a week.
zh: 但我每周得值两次夜班。

en: But it's very strong actually.
zh: 但实际上这东西挺结实的。

en: The following day, however, the doctor consoled him by telling him that his chances of being able to leave hospital in time for New Year celebrations were good.
zh: 不过第二天医生安慰他说，他很有希望赶在过年前出院。

en: But I can't understand them very well.
zh: 但我不太听得懂他们说的话。

en: But you don't have to stay to the end.
zh: 但你没必要待到最后。

en: Now she lay weak in bed.
zh: 现在她虚弱地躺在床上。

en: It's expensive though.
zh: 不过这挺贵的。

en: I think you should get more rest.
zh: 我觉得你应该多休息。

en: You may as well get used to it.
zh: 你最好还是习惯一下吧。

en: But we call him Tony at home.
zh: 但我们在家里都管他叫托尼。

en: But Dad won't like it.
zh: 但爸爸不会喜欢的。

en: But I don't think Dad would like me to.
zh: 但我觉得爸爸不会想让我这么做的。

en: Secret police moved among the crowd during the demonstration.
zh: 游行的时候，秘密警察混在人群里。

en: You know, sometimes you need to hear it.
zh: 你知道的，有时候你确实需要听听这些。

en: But we don't have anything in common at all.
zh: 但我们根本没有共同语言。

en: I'm going to join a demonstration.
zh: 我要去参加游行。

en: But probably I'll be the last, which is a pity.
zh: 但我可能就是最后一个了，真可惜。

en: Oh, but he did come to Tokyo alone.
zh: 噢，但他确实是一个人来东京的。

en: But, I have to take my mother.
zh: 但我得带着我妈。

en: But we're just on our way home.
zh: 但我们正准备回家呢。

en: While the demonstration was being made, the president was taking notes.
zh: 示威进行的时候，总统正在做笔记。

en: But it's almost half past eleven.
zh: 但都快十一点半了。

en: But what will you do if he doesn't come?
zh: 但要是他不来你打算怎么办？

en: But I was always too lazy.
zh: 但我一直都太懒了。

en: He can afford the time to play the guitar though.
zh: 不过他倒是有时间弹吉他。

en: But you will write, won't you?
zh: 但你会写信的，对吧？

en: But I have no apples left to give you.
zh: 但我已经没有苹果可以给你了。

en: But I have nothing left. I am just an old stump.
zh: 但我什么都没剩下了。我只是个老树桩。

en: But I don't think the pool is open this weekend.
zh: 但我觉得这周末游泳池不开门。

en: "But you just come here in the summer!" Said Tony.
zh: “但你只是夏天才来这儿啊！”托尼说。

en: But, I'm going steady.
zh: 但我已经有对象了。

en: But of course that was a long time ago.
zh: 不过那当然是很久以前的事了。

en: But they are all people.
zh: 但他们毕竟都是人啊。

en: Well, it wasn't all that bad.
zh: 其实也没那么糟。

en: But it was like trying to stop the rain from falling.
zh: 但这就像是想让雨停下来一样。

en: But you like it!
zh: 可你喜欢啊！

en: But you're going to owe me one.
zh: 不过你可欠我一个人情。

en: But while I am here, do you think you could replace the batteries?
zh: 不过既然我在这儿，能不能帮我把电池换了？

en: It has too many disadvantages.
zh: 这东西缺点太多了。

en: I have sailed up the Thames once.
zh: 我曾在泰晤士河上航行过一次。

en: The Thames is a river that flows through London.
zh: 泰晤士河是流经伦敦的一条河。

en: She was fat, and holding a monkey.
zh: 她挺胖的，手里还抱着只猴子。

en: David can speak French fluently.
zh: 大卫的法语说得很流利。

en: David worked his way through college.
zh: 大卫是靠半工半读读完大学的。

en: David is very active.
zh: 大卫这人挺活跃的。

en: David has so many girlfriends that he can't remember all of their names.
zh: 大卫的女朋友多到他连名字都记不住。

en: Debbie! Can you hear me?
zh: 黛比！你能听到我说话吗？

en: I said hello to Debby but she totally ignored me.
zh: 我跟黛比打招呼，但她完全没理我。

en: Debbie, is your school near here?
zh: 黛比，你学校在这附近吗？

en: I will ask him about it tomorrow, then.
zh: 那我明天再问问他吧。

en: Then let us begin.
zh: 那我们就开始吧。

en: See you tonight, then. Cheers!
zh: 那今晚见，拜拜！

en: Let's discuss the respective merits of the candidates.
zh: 咱们来讨论下候选人各自的长处吧。

en: Shall we start the meeting now?
zh: 咱们现在就开始开会吗？

en: See you again tomorrow.
zh: 明天见。

en: I am afraid I must be going now.
zh: 我恐怕得走了。

en: The department store was crammed with holiday shoppers.
zh: 商场里挤满了节假日出来购物的人。

en: Department stores sell numerous things.
zh: 百货商店卖的东西可多了。

en: You can get all kinds of things to eat if you go to the free samples area in a department store.
zh: 去商场的试吃区，你能吃到各种各样的东西。

en: There is an advertising balloon flying above the department store.
zh: 商场上空飘着一个广告气球。

en: I got a new hat at the department store.
zh: 我在商场买了个新帽子。

en: You can see the large exhibition at the department store anytime.
zh: 商场里的那个大型展览你随时都能去看。

en: A very pleasant young woman waited on me in the department store.
zh: 商场里有个态度特别好的年轻姑娘接待了我。

en: We start here in two hours, then.
zh: 那我们两小时后在这儿开始。

en: Well, see you later.

en: Please sponge the mess up of the table.
zh: 请用海绵把桌子上的脏东西擦掉。

en: Don't put the glass near the edge of the table.
zh: 别把玻璃杯放在桌子边儿上。

en: Will you please wipe the dust off the table?
zh: 能麻烦你擦擦桌子上的灰吗？

en: There were four chairs by the table.
zh: 桌子旁边有四把椅子。

en: You can have any cake on the table.
zh: 桌上的蛋糕你随便吃。

en: There are footprints of a cat on the table.
zh: 桌子上有猫的脚印。

en: Stop resting your elbows on the table.
zh: 别老把胳膊肘支在桌子上。

en: Don't put your elbows on the table.
zh: 别把胳膊肘放在桌子上。

en: A table has four legs.
zh: 桌子有四条腿。

en: She put the magazine on the table.
zh: 她把杂志放在了桌子上。

en: Were there any glasses on the table?
zh: 桌子上有杯子吗？

en: There are some oranges on the table.
zh: 桌子上有一些橙子。

en: The tablecloth is in the cabinet.
zh: 桌布在柜子里。

en: I spilled coffee on your tablecloth.
zh: 我把咖啡洒在你的桌布上了。

en: The table was groaning with food.
zh: 桌上摆满了丰盛的食物。

en: Please join the two ends of the tape together.
zh: 请把胶带的两头接在一起。

en: Don't expose the tapes to the sun.
zh: 别把磁带放在太阳下晒。

en: The tape is rolling.
zh: 磁带正在转。

en: We examined the following magazines to collect the data.
zh: 为了收集数据，我们查阅了以下杂志。

en: They conducted the following experiment to collect the data.
zh: 为了收集数据，他们做了以下实验。

en: The data hasn't been compiled yet.
zh: 数据还没整理出来。

en: The data is often inaccurate.
zh: 数据经常不太准。

en: Data can be transmitted from the main computer to yours, and vice versa.
zh: 数据可以在主电脑和你的电脑之间互传。

en: Computer technology is indispensable to access many pertinent items of data.
zh: 要获取许多相关的资料，计算机技术是必不可少的。

en: As is evident from the data, smoking is not decreasing among the young.
zh: 从数据可以看出，年轻人的吸烟人数并没有减少。

en: Mrs. Davis was anything but a perfect wife.
zh: 戴维斯夫人一点儿也不是个完美的妻子。
